body_html:
@apaszke You are right. Normally, the user should create the data set with labels set to be Python int correctly. The purpose of PR is just make it still work even the user forgot to convert them from np.float.
This will not be the case for popular standard data set, but artificial data set sometimes.
body_text:
@apaszke You are right. Normally, the user should create the data set with labels set to be Python int correctly. The purpose of PR is just make it still work even the user forgot to convert them from np.float.
This will not be the case for popular standard data set, but artificial data set sometimes.
body:
@apaszke You are right. Normally, the user should create the data set with labels set to be Python `int` correctly. The purpose of PR is just make it still work even the user forgot to convert them from `np.float`. 
This will not be the case for popular standard data set, but artificial data set sometimes.
